1. The training rule on not giving the full admission to a trainee nun

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā sikkhamānā thullanandaṁ bhikkhuniṁ upasaṅkamitvā upasampadaṁ yāci.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññatarā sikkhamānā thullanandam bhikkhunim upasaṅkamitvā upasampadam yāci
translated: a certain trainee nun went to the nun Thullanandā and asked for full admission.
Thullanandā said to her,

original: “sace me tvaṁ, ayye, cīvaraṁ dassasi evāhaṁ taṁ vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti vatvā, neva vuṭṭhāpeti na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṁ karoti.
analyzed: sace me tva ayye cīvaram dassasi eva aham tam vuṭṭhāpessāmi iti vatvā na iva vuṭṭhāpeti na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkam karoti
translated: “If you give me a robe, Venerable, I’ll give you the full admission.” And she neither gave her the full admission nor made any effort to have her fully admitted.

original: Atha kho sā sikkhamānā bhikkhunīnaṁ etamatthaṁ ārocesi.
analyzed: atha kho sā sikkhamānā bhikkhunīnam etam attham ārocesi
translated: That trainee nun then told the nuns what had happened.

original: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: yāḥ tāḥ bhikkhuniyaḥ appicchāḥ pe tāḥ ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: Those nuns who were modest … criticized and complained and spread it about:
“How could Venerable Thullanandā say to a trainee nun,

original: ‘sace me tvaṁ, ayye, cīvaraṁ dassasi evāhaṁ taṁ vuṭṭhāpessāmī’ti vatvā, neva vuṭṭhāpessati na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṁ karissatī”ti …pe…
analyzed: sace me tva ayye cīvaram dassasi eva aham tam vuṭṭhāpessāmi iti vatvā na iva vuṭṭhāpessati na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkam karissati iti pe
translated: ‘If you give me a robe, I’ll give you the full admission,’ but then neither gives her the full admission nor makes any effort to have her fully admitted.” …

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī sikkhamānaṁ—🔽‘sace me tvaṁ, ayye, cīvaraṁ dassasi evāhaṁ taṁ vuṭṭhāpessāmī’ti vatvā, neva vuṭṭhāpeti na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṁ karotī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave thullanandā bhikkhunī sikkhamāna  sace me tva ayye cīvaram dassasi eva aham tam vuṭṭhāpessāmi iti vatvā na iva vuṭṭhāpeti na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkam karoti iti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
“It’s true, Sir.”
The Buddha rebuked her …

original: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī sikkhamānaṁ—🔽‘sace me tvaṁ, ayye, cīvaraṁ dassasi evāhaṁ taṁ vuṭṭhāpessāmī’ti vatvā, neva vuṭṭhāpessati na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṁ karissati.
analyzed: kathan hi nāma bhikkhave thullanandā bhikkhunī sikkhamāna  sace me tva ayye cīvaram dassasi eva aham tam vuṭṭhāpessāmi iti vatvā na iva vuṭṭhāpessati na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkam karissati
translated: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?🔽‘If you give me a robe, I’ll give you the full admission,’ but then neither give her the full admission nor make any effort to have her fully admitted.

analyzed: na ita bhikkhave appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: This won’t create confidence in those without it …

original: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddisantu—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave bhikkhuniyaḥ imam sikkhāpadam uddisantu
translated: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:🔽‘If a nun says to a trainee nun,

original: “Yā pana bhikkhunī sikkhamānaṁ—‘sace me tvaṁ, ayye, cīvaraṁ dassasi, evāhaṁ taṁ vuṭṭhāpessāmī’ti
analyzed: yā pana bhikkhunī sikkhamāna sace me tva ayye cīvaram dassasi eva aham tam vuṭṭhāpessāmi iti
translated: ‘If a nun says to a trainee nun, “If you give me a robe, I’ll give you the full admission,”

original: vatvā, sā pacchā anantarāyikinī neva vuṭṭhāpeyya na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṁ kareyya, pācittiyan”ti.
analyzed: vatvā sā pacchā anantarāyikinī na iva vuṭṭhāpeyya na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkam kareyya pācittiyam ti
translated: and she then neither gives her the full admission nor makes any effort to have her fully admitted, except if there are obstacles, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
If a nun:
if a nun who is such and such …🔽the nun who is spoken of here is the nun so-and-so.

original: bhikkhunīti🔽…pe… ayaṁ imasmiṁ atthe adhippetā bhikkhunīti.🔽Sikkhamānā nāma
analyzed: bhikkhunī iti  pe ayam imasmin atthe adhippetā bhikkhunī iti  sikkhamānā nāma
translated: A trainee nun:

analyzed: dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhita sikkhā
translated: one who has trained for two years in the six rules.

original: Sace me tvaṁ, ayye, cīvaraṁ dassasi evāhaṁ taṁ vuṭṭhāpessāmīti
analyzed: sace me tva ayye cīvaram dassasi eva aham tam vuṭṭhāpessāmi iti
translated: If you give me a robe, I’ll give you the full admission:
I’ll give you the full ordination.
and she then neither gives her the full admission:

analyzed: asati antarāye  na iva vuṭṭhāpeyya ati  na sayam vuṭṭhāpeyya
translated: unless there are obstacles.
Nor makes any effort to have her fully admitted:
she does not ask anyone else.

original: “Neva vuṭṭhāpessāmi na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṁ karissāmī”ti dhuraṁ nikkhittamatte āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Anāpatti—
analyzed: na iva vuṭṭhāpessāmi na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkam karissāmi iti dhuram nikkhitta matte āpatti pācittiyassa  anāpatti
translated: If she thinks, “I’ll neither give her the full admission nor make any effort to have her fully admitted,” then by the mere fact of giving up her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
There is no offense if there are obstacles;🔽if she searches for a teacher, but does not find one;
If she searches for one and does not get one;
If she is sick;
If there is a danger;🔽If she is crazy;
If she is the first offender.
The seventh training rule is finished.
